title: ISC2 CISSP Practice Questions - Set 5 (Q201-250)
description: Complete CISSP certification exam practice questions - Final set

questions.question: Why is it important that senior management clearly communicates the formal Maximum Tolerable Downtime (MTD) decision?
options: To provide each manager with precise direction on selecting an appropriate recovery alternative
To demonstrate to the board of directors that senior management is committed to continuity recovery efforts
To provide a formal declaration from senior management as required by internal audit to demonstrate sound business practices
To demonstrate to the regulatory bodies that the company takes business continuity seriously
questions.explanation: Clear communication of MTD provides managers with specific parameters for selecting recovery alternatives that meet business requirements and align with organizational risk tolerance.

questions.question: A Simple Power Analysis (SPA) attack against a device directly observes which of the following?
questions.explanation: Simple Power Analysis attacks observe power consumption patterns of cryptographic devices to extract secret information such as encryption keys from the variations in electrical power usage.

questions.question: Which of the following MUST the administrator of a security information and event management (SIEM) system ensure?
options: All sources are synchronized with a common time reference
All sources are reporting in the exact same Extensible Markup Language (XML) format
Data sources do not contain information infringing upon privacy regulations
Each source uses the same Internet Protocol (IP) address for reporting
questions.explanation: Time synchronization is critical for SIEM systems to correlate events accurately across different sources. Without synchronized timestamps, incident reconstruction and analysis become unreliable.

questions.question: An organization wants to share data securely with their partners via the Internet. Which standard port is typically used to meet this requirement?
options: Setup a server on User Datagram Protocol (UDP) port 69
Setup a server on Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port 21
Setup a server on Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port 22
Setup a server on Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port 80
questions.explanation: TCP port 22 is used for SSH/SFTP, which provides secure, encrypted file transfer over the Internet, making it the standard choice for secure data sharing.

questions.question: When designing a business continuity plan (BCP), what is the formula to determine the Maximum Tolerable Downtime (MTD)?
options: Estimated Maximum Loss (EML) + Recovery Time Objective (RTO)
Business impact analysis (BIA) + Recovery Point Objective (RPO)
Annual Loss Expectancy (ALE) + Work Recovery Time (WRT)
Recovery Time Objective (RTO) + Work Recovery Time (WRT)
questions.explanation: MTD is calculated as RTO (time to restore systems) plus WRT (time to restore operations to normal), representing the total maximum acceptable downtime.

questions.question: In systems security engineering, what does the security principle of modularity provide?
options: Minimal access to perform a function
Secure distribution of programs and data
questions.explanation: Modularity provides isolation of functions and data into separate components, reducing interdependencies and limiting the impact of security failures to individual modules.

questions.question: Which of the following is the strongest physical access control?
options: Biometrics, a password, and personal identification number (PIN)
Biometrics, a password, and badge reader
questions.explanation: Combining biometrics (something you are), password (something you know), and badge reader (something you have) provides three-factor authentication, the strongest access control.

questions.question: An access control list (ACL) on a router is a feature MOST similar to which type of firewall?
questions.explanation: Router ACLs perform packet filtering based on source/destination IP addresses, ports, and protocols, similar to packet filtering firewalls that examine individual packets.

questions.question: While dealing with the consequences of a security incident, which of the following security controls are MOST appropriate?
questions.explanation: After an incident occurs, corrective controls fix the vulnerability and recovery controls restore systems and operations, addressing both immediate remediation and restoration needs.

questions.question: A cloud hosting provider would like to provide a Service Organization Control (SOC) report relevant to its security program. This report should be an abbreviated report that can be freely distributed. Which type of report BEST meets this requirement?
questions.explanation: SOC 3 is a general-use report that provides a summary of security controls without detailed technical information, designed for public distribution and marketing purposes.

questions.question: Which of the following is TRUE for an organization that is using a third-party federated identity service?
options: The organization specifies alone how to authenticate other organization's users
The organization defines internal standard for overall user identification
The organization establishes a trust relationship with the other organizations
The organization enforces the rules to other organization's user provisioning
questions.explanation: Federated identity requires establishing trust relationships between organizations, allowing users from one organization to access resources in another based on mutual trust agreements.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the BEST method of maintaining the inventory of software and hardware within the organization?
options: Maintaining the inventory through a combination of asset owner interviews, open-source system management, and open-source management tools
Maintaining the inventory through a combination of desktop configuration, administration management, and procurement management tools
Maintaining the inventory through a combination of on premise storage configuration, cloud management, and partner management tools
Maintaining the inventory through a combination of system configuration, network management, and license management tools
questions.explanation: Combining system configuration tools, network management tools, and license management provides comprehensive visibility into hardware, software, and licensing across the organization.

questions.question: Which of the following outsourcing agreement provisions has the HIGHEST priority from a security operations perspective?
options: Conditions to prevent the use of subcontractors
Terms for contract renegotiation in case of disaster
Root cause analysis for application performance issue
Escalation process for problem resolution during incidents
questions.explanation: From a security operations perspective, having clear escalation processes ensures security incidents can be quickly addressed and resolved with appropriate authority and resources.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST comprehensive Business Continuity (BC) test?
questions.explanation: Full interruption testing actually shuts down primary operations to test complete failover to backup systems, providing the most realistic and comprehensive assessment of BC capabilities.

questions.question: A security practitioner needs to implement a solution to verify endpoint security protections and operating system (OS) versions. Which of the following is the BEST solution to implement?
questions.explanation: NAC systems verify endpoint compliance with security policies including OS versions, patch levels, and security software before granting network access.

questions.question: During an internal audit of an organizational Information Security Management System (ISMS), nonconformities are identified. In which of the following management stages are nonconformities reviewed, assessed and/or corrected by the organization?
questions.explanation: The Improvement stage of ISMS management focuses on reviewing nonconformities, implementing corrective actions, and continuously improving the security management system.

questions.question: When developing an external facing web-based system, which of the following would be the MAIN focus of the security assessment prior to implementation and production?
options: Ensuring Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificates are signed by a certificate authority
Ensuring Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificates are internally signed
Ensuring that input validation is enforced
questions.explanation: Input validation is critical for web applications to prevent injection attacks, XSS, and other vulnerabilities that could compromise the application and data.

questions.question: A financial services organization has employed a security consultant to review processes used by employees across various teams. The consultant interviewed a member of the application development practice and found gaps in their threat model. Which of the following correctly represents a trigger for when a threat model should be revised?
options: After operating system (OS) patches are applied
A new developer is hired into the team
After a modification to the firewall rule policy
A new data repository is added
questions.explanation: Adding a new data repository changes the application's attack surface and data flows, requiring threat model revision to assess new risks and security controls.

questions.question: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) of an organization has requested that a Service Organization Control (SOC) report be created to outline the security and availability of a particular system over a 12-month period. Which type of SOC report should be utilized?
questions.explanation: SOC 2 Type 2 evaluates security and availability controls over a period of time (minimum 6 months), making it appropriate for a 12-month assessment.

questions.question: An organization recently upgraded to a Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) phone system. Management is concerned with unauthorized phone usage. The security consultant is responsible for putting together a plan to secure these phones. Administrators have assigned unique personal identification number (PIN) codes for each person in the organization. What is the BEST solution?
options: Have the administrator enforce a policy to change the PIN regularly. Implement call detail records (CDR) reports to track usage
Have the administrator change the PIN regularly. Implement call detail records (CDR) reports to track usage
Use phone locking software to enforce usage and PIN policies. Inform the user to change the PIN regularly
Implement call detail records (CDR) reports to track usage
questions.explanation: Enforcing regular PIN changes through policy combined with CDR monitoring provides both preventive controls (PIN changes) and detective controls (usage tracking).

questions.question: Which of the following protection is provided when using a Virtual Private Network (VPN) with Authentication Header (AH)?
questions.explanation: IPSec AH provides authentication and integrity verification, ensuring non-repudiation by confirming the sender's identity and that data hasn't been altered.

questions.question: An organization contracts with a consultant to perform a System Organization Control (SOC) 2 audit on their internal security controls. An auditor documents a finding related to an Application Programming Interface (API) performing an action that is not aligned with the scope or objective of the system. Which trust service principle would be MOST applicable in this situation?
questions.explanation: Processing Integrity ensures that system processing is complete, valid, accurate, timely, and authorized. An API performing out-of-scope actions violates processing integrity.

questions.question: In which process MUST security be considered during the acquisition of new software?
questions.explanation: Security requirements must be included in the RFP to ensure vendors understand security expectations from the beginning and can propose appropriate solutions.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MAIN difference between a network-based firewall and a host-based firewall?
options: A network-based firewall is stateful, while a host-based firewall is stateless
A network-based firewall blocks network intrusions, while a host-based firewall blocks malware
A network-based firewall controls traffic passing through the device, while a host-based firewall controls traffic destined for the device
A network-based firewall verifies network traffic, while a host-based firewall verifies processes and applications
questions.explanation: Network firewalls filter traffic passing through them to protect networks, while host-based firewalls protect individual systems by filtering traffic destined for that specific host.

questions.question: Which of the following measures serves as the BEST means for protecting data on computers, smartphones, and external storage devices when traveling to high-risk countries?
options: Review applicable destination country laws, forensically clean devices prior to travel, and only download sensitive data over a virtual private network (VPN) upon arriving at the destination
Leverage a Secure Socket Layer (SSL) connection over a virtual private network (VPN) to download sensitive data upon arriving at the destination
Keep laptops, external storage devices, and smartphones in the hotel room when not in use
Use multi-factor authentication (MFA) to gain access to data stored on laptops or external storage devices and biometric fingerprint access control mechanisms to unlock smartphones
questions.explanation: Cleaning devices before travel and only downloading necessary data through VPN at destination minimizes exposure and ensures compliance with local laws while protecting sensitive information.

questions.question: When network management is outsourced to third parties, which of the following is the MOST effective method of protecting critical data assets?
options: Confirm that confidentiality agreements are signed
Log all activities associated with sensitive systems
questions.explanation: Strong access controls directly limit what outsourced personnel can access, providing the most effective technical protection for critical data assets.

questions.question: Which of the following regulations dictates how data breaches are handled?
options: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS)
National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
questions.explanation: GDPR specifically mandates breach notification requirements, including 72-hour notification to authorities and affected individuals, making it the primary regulation for breach handling.

questions.question: In software development, developers should use which type of queries to prevent a Structured Query Language (SQL) injection?
questions.explanation: Parameterized queries (prepared statements) separate SQL code from data, preventing SQL injection by treating user input as data rather than executable code.

questions.question: Which type of access control includes a system that allows only users that are type=managers and department=sales to access employee records?
questions.explanation: ABAC makes access decisions based on multiple attributes (type=managers AND department=sales), providing fine-grained, policy-based access control.

questions.question: Which of the following examples is BEST to minimize the attack surface for a customer's private information?
questions.explanation: Collection limitation reduces attack surface by not collecting unnecessary data in the first place. Data that doesn't exist cannot be stolen or compromised.

questions.question: Which evidence collecting technique would be utilized when it is believed an attacker is employing a rootkit and a quick analysis is needed?
questions.explanation: Live response captures volatile data from running systems, essential for detecting rootkits that hide on disk but are visible in memory and running processes.

questions.question: An application is used for funds transfers between an organization and a third-party. During a security audit, an auditor has found an issue with the business continuity disaster recovery policy and procedures for this application. Which of the following reports should the auditor file with the organization?
questions.explanation: SOC 2 addresses security, availability, and other operational controls including business continuity and disaster recovery, making it appropriate for this finding.

questions.question: When determining data and information asset handling, regardless of the specific toolset being used, which of the following is one of the common components of big data?
questions.explanation: Big data architectures typically use distributed storage systems (like Hadoop HDFS) to handle massive volumes of data across multiple nodes for scalability and performance.

questions.question: A Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) of a firm which decided to migrate to cloud has been tasked with ensuring an optimal level of security. Which of the following would be the FIRST consideration?
options: Analyze the firm's applications and data repositories to determine the relevant control requirements
Request a security risk assessment of the cloud vendor be completed by an independent third-party
Define the cloud migration roadmap and set out which applications and data repositories should be moved into the cloud
Ensure that the contract between the cloud vendor and the firm clearly defines responsibilities for operating security controls
questions.explanation: Before cloud migration, the organization must understand its security requirements by analyzing applications and data to determine necessary controls and appropriate cloud deployment models.

questions.question: Which of the following BEST describes the purpose of Border Gateway Protocol (BGP)?
options: Provide Routing Information Protocol (RIP) version 2 advertisements to neighboring layer 3 devices
Maintain a list of network paths between internet routers
Provide firewall services to cloud-enabled applications
Maintain a list of efficient network paths between autonomous systems
questions.explanation: BGP is the core routing protocol of the Internet, maintaining routing tables of efficient paths between autonomous systems (ASs) for inter-domain routing.

questions.question: What is the BEST design for securing physical perimeter protection?
questions.explanation: CPTED is a comprehensive design philosophy that uses environmental design to reduce crime opportunity, incorporating natural surveillance, access control, and territorial reinforcement.

questions.question: The security organization is looking for a solution that could help them determine with a strong level of confidence that attackers have breached their network. Which solution is MOST effective at discovering a successful network breach?
questions.explanation: IDS monitors network traffic for suspicious activity and known attack patterns, providing alerts when breaches occur, making it most effective for breach detection.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of implementing data-in-use controls?
options: If the data is lost, it must be decrypted to be opened
When the data is being viewed, it can only be printed by authorized users
When the data is being viewed, it can be accessed using secure protocols
If the data is lost, it may not be accessible to unauthorized users
questions.explanation: Data-in-use controls manage what users can do with data while actively using it, such as restricting printing, copying, or forwarding to authorized users only.

questions.question: When configuring Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) in a Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) network, which of the following authentication types is the MOST secure?
questions.explanation: EAP-TLS provides the strongest security by requiring both client and server certificates for mutual authentication, using public key infrastructure for secure authentication.

questions.question: Which of the following would be the BEST guideline to follow when attempting to avoid the exposure of sensitive data?
options: Monitor mail servers for sensitive data being exfiltrated
Educate end-users on methods of attacks on sensitive data
Establish report parameters for sensitive data
Store sensitive data only when necessary
questions.explanation: The best way to avoid data exposure is data minimization - only storing sensitive data when absolutely necessary reduces the attack surface and potential exposure.

questions.question: An organization with divisions in the United States (US) and the United Kingdom (UK) processes data comprised of personal information belonging to subjects living in the European Union (EU) and in the US. Which data MUST be handled according to the privacy protections of General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)?
options: Only data processed in the UK
questions.explanation: GDPR applies to personal data of EU residents regardless of where processing occurs or the citizenship of data subjects. Residency, not citizenship, determines GDPR applicability.

questions.question: What are the first two components of logical access control?
questions.explanation: Logical access control begins with identification (claiming an identity) followed by authentication (proving that identity) before authorization can be granted.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST effective measure for dealing with rootkit attacks?
options: Restoring the system from the last backup
Finding and replacing the altered binaries with legitimate ones
Turning off unauthorized services and rebooting the system
Reinstalling the system from trusted sources
questions.explanation: Rootkits deeply compromise systems at low levels. Complete reinstallation from trusted sources is the only way to ensure all rootkit components are removed.

questions.question: Which of the following is the FIRST requirement a data owner should consider before implementing a data retention policy?
questions.explanation: Legal requirements (regulations, laws, litigation holds) must be considered first to ensure compliance before determining business needs, storage, or training requirements.

questions.question: A new employee formally reported suspicious behavior to the organization security team. The report claims that someone not affiliated with the organization was inquiring about the member's work location, length of employment, and building access controls. The employee's reporting is MOST likely the result of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The employee recognizing and reporting suspicious social engineering attempts demonstrates effective security awareness training in identifying potential security threats.

questions.question: The disaster recovery (DR) process should always include:
questions.explanation: DR plans require regular maintenance to remain effective as systems, personnel, and business requirements change. Outdated plans fail during actual disasters.

questions.question: An organization has determined that its previous waterfall approach to software development is not keeping pace with business demands. To adapt to the rapid changes required for product delivery, the organization has decided to move towards an Agile software development and release cycle. In order to ensure the success of the Agile methodology, who is the MOST critical in creating acceptance criteria for each release?
questions.explanation: In Agile, business customers (product owners) define acceptance criteria to ensure releases meet actual business needs and deliver value to stakeholders.

questions.question: What is the FIRST step for an organization to take before allowing personnel to access social media from a corporate device or user account?
options: Publish a social media guidelines document
Document a procedure for accessing social media sites
questions.explanation: An acceptable usage policy must be established first to define what is and isn't permitted, providing the foundation for guidelines, training, and procedures.

questions.question: A hospital has allowed virtual private networking (VPN) access to remote database developers. Upon auditing the internal configuration, the network administrator discovered that split-tunneling was enabled. What is the concern with this configuration?
options: The network intrusion detection system (NIDS) will fail to inspect Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) traffic
Remote sessions will not require multi-layer authentication
Remote clients are permitted to exchange traffic with the public and private network
Multiple Internet Protocol Security (IPSec) tunnels may be exploitable in specific circumstances
questions.explanation: Split-tunneling allows simultaneous connections to both VPN and public networks, creating a security risk as compromised remote systems can bridge trusted and untrusted networks.

questions.question: In an IDEAL encryption system, who has sole access to the decryption key?
questions.explanation: In an ideal system, the data owner who classifies and is responsible for the data should have sole access to decryption keys, maintaining control over their sensitive information.
